quoteFirst: Then we continued our wearisome tramp. An age seemed to pass. I looked at my watch, but it was only
quoteLast: . To and fro we went with bruised shoulders, aching backs and numbed intelligence. I fell into a kind of semi-conscious state. Suddenly the whistle blew for lunch.
title: Combed Out
author: Voigt, F. A. (Frederick Augustus), 1892-1957

quoteFirst: Over the visiphone screen, a large lighted panel announced the date in sharp black letters: 32 April, 2109. Below it, the little transistor clock had just changed to read
quoteLast: Almost noon. And every passing minute his quarry drew farther and farther away.
title: A Man Obsessed
author: Nourse, Alan Edward, 1928-1992
